titleInfo.title: Pre-Columbian Tomaco la Tolita human figurine

mods.abstract: Pre-Columbian ceramic figure adorned with an ornate collar, ear pieces, and headress with depicted horns. The figure is holding a ball of some sort at its waist over clothing. Behind the human figure is a large horizontally ridged structure that looks as if it was larger at some point but has been broken off making it into a more diamond shape. There are two holes spaced 1 1/2 inches apart above an inscribed ET.

Besides the background of the figure being broken off, there is also chipping on the nose of the figure and some at the ornate collar. There is also some other pitting and a faded red paint. Overall the figure is in good condition.

titleInfo.title: Pre-Columbian figurines
